```{r}

# Numeric example
x <- c(0.5, 0.6)
age <- c(20, 35, 32, 29)

# Summary of numeric vector
summary(age)

# Reassign age with new values
age <- c(35, 24, 18, 24)

# Mean of new age values
mean(age)

#Logical 
x <- c(TRUE,FALSE)
x <- c(T,F)

#Character 
x <- c("a","b","c")
class <-c("M","F","F","M")

#Integer
x <-9:29


#Complex
x<- c(1+0i, 2+4i)
x

#Matrix and Operation within Matrices
x<-matrix(1:6, nrow=2 ,ncol=3)
x

y<-matrix(1:6,nrow =3 ,ncol =2 )
y

x%*%y

#List
x<-list(1,"a",TRUE,1+4i)
x

#Factor 
x<-factor(c("yes","yes","no","yes","no"))
x

#Create a vector with NA in it 
x<-c(1,2,NA,10,3)
##check which number in  X is NA 
is.na(x)

x <- c(1, 2, 4, "NA", 5)
bad <- is.na(x)
x[!bad]

x <- c(1, 2, NA, 4, NA, 5)
y <- c("a", "b", NA, "d", NA, "f")
good <- complete.cases(x, y)
good

# Coercion
sum(c(TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE))
#11. Create Data Frame
studentID <- c(1,2,3,4,5)
math_score <- c(12,17,10,9,NA)
gender <- c("M","F","M","M","F")
it_score <- c(13,18,11,10,19)
scoredata <- data.frame(studentID, gender, math_score, it_score)
scoredata

#Built-in Dataset Example
data("airquality")
variable.names(airquality)
str(airquality)
summary(airquality)

#Exploration Data Analysis (EDA)
data_class <- data.frame(
HEIGHT = c(161,155,158,170,160,156,162,158,158,167,160,155,154,155,157,157,160,158,160,160,
152,154,150,161,162,164,161,155,159,163,159,160,158,165,156,163,155,164,163,168,
157,164),
WEIGHT = c(50,49,42,65,60,52,58,46,45,51,60,42,53,48,48,48,53,52,51,53,
44,56,63,52,57,49,52,54,46,50,61,55,45,63,60,56,52,47,52,55,
48,58)
)
summary(data_class)
apply(data_class,2,mean)
apply(data_class,2,sd)

#Relationship Between Variables – iris Dataset
data("iris")
by(iris$Petal.Length, iris$Species, summary)
boxplot(iris$Sepal.Length ~ iris$Species, data = iris, main="Comparison")

#Relationship Between Two Categorical Variables
ucba <- data.frame(UCBAdmissions)
(cross <- xtabs(Freq ~ Gender + Admit, data = ucba))
prop.table(cross, 2)

#Bar Chart
dat <- read.table(text ="ProdA ProdB ProdC ProdD
1 110 50 60 70
2 120 50 80 65", header=TRUE)
barplot(as.matrix(dat), beside=FALSE, col=c("red","green"))

#Scatter Plot

plot(WEIGHT ~ HEIGHT, data=data_class)
cor(data_class$HEIGHT, data_class$WEIGHT)

#Linear Model
plot(WEIGHT ~ HEIGHT, data=data_class)
abline(lm(WEIGHT ~ HEIGHT, data=data_class))
summary(lm(WEIGHT ~ HEIGHT, data=data_class))

#Data Management – Creating BMI
BMI <- round(data_class$WEIGHT / (data_class$HEIGHT/100)^2, 2)
new_data_class <- cbind(data_class, BMI)
head(new_data_class, n=5)
summary(BMI)
stem(BMI, scale=2)

```
